paper_abstract: This paper advances our knowledge of information systems (IS) management by applying ideas and insights from accounting. An integrative cost-benefit framework is developed and applied to four areas of research: chargeback, outsourcing, decision support, and business process re-engineering and improvement. We show that the accounting literature contributes significantly to scholarship on the management of IS. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Management of information systems: Insights from accounting research
